burlap.oomdp.singleagent.common

Class VisualActionObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • burlap.oomdp.singleagent.common.VisualActionObserver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionObserver, EnvironmentObserver, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class VisualActionObserver
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements ActionObserver, EnvironmentObserver
    This class enables the live rendering of action calls or environment interactions, by implementing the ActionObserver and EnvironmentObserver interfaces. It updates the visualizer to show the resulting state of an action call. After rendering, the client thread is blocked for a specified interval of time to allow the state to be observed (by default the value is set to 17ms, which is about 60FPS). This class will also render the new state of an Environment after a Environment.resetEnvironment() message is observed and block for the same interval of time. This class is especially useful for watching learning algorithms or Monte Carlo-like planning algorithms in action.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • replayEpisode

        public void replayEpisode(EpisodeAnalysis ea)
        Causes the visualizer to replay through the provided EpisodeAnalysis object. The initial state of the provided episode is first rendered for the given refresh delay of this object, and then each action and resulting state in the episode is feed through the actionEvent(State, GroundedAction, State) method of this object.
        Parameters:
        ea - the episode to be replayed.
